ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great opportunity to research deeply into interesting topic of choice. Learn new programming skills and fields of computer science. Fun to work with other students and mentors in lab.
Research abilities, and research-specific knowledge.

Through this course, I was able to work on an interesting Computer Science project that served as a rewarding culmination of my degree. Specifically, I learned about new technologies while contributing to a professor's research.
Good skills
Formulating and executing a research plan; performing experiments and writing papers.
I gained knowledge on how to perform my own research and learned about the topic of my choosing.

I learned a great deal about drone flight and how to adapt feature detection libraries to recognize user gestures. I also had to brainstorm a great deal to come up with a solution that would integrate these two fields.
I learned a lot about natural language processing and individual research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Flexible, free to work on any topic, and fun. A lot of resources for getting help for the course.

Strengths: Ability to work on a project you care about, ability to define the scope of your project

Weaknesses: Sometimes I felt as if I was really just on my own and lacking adequate mentorship. This will likely vary with your advisor though. Ultimately, this wasn't the worst thing though as I found it extremely rewarding to solve many problems on my own and learned a lot in the process.
Good

I like that this course allows students to be involved in their own interests and pursue research from an independent perspective. One weakness of the course is that the syllabus is unclear on the requirements of the course for double majors at some points.

It is individual research, so everyone has their own experience. I would maybe set more clear guidelines or deadlines so it isn't just the proposal at the beginning of the semester and the final report at the end.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, requirement for CS majors.
Yes -- a long-term research project is certainly an important experience.

This course is a requirement for the major, so I suppose I would recommend CS majors to take it. Put differently, I would recommend students have a well-thought-out idea of what they want to work on before committing to a project as this is a semester-long project that can be a lot of fun or a lot of pain depending on your interest level.
Yes
Definitely!
I would recommend this course to any Cs majors who are interested in seeing if research is right for them.
POD was a great project to work on, and Id recommend any student to contribute.
All CS majors have to take it so yes. I would definitely recommend a first semester thesis senior year. Great learning experience and pretty much nothing to worry about second semester.
